definition: to tear down/to destroy/to dismantle (a gang)/to abort (a fetus)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)
lit. to swallow one's knocked-out teeth after getting punched in the face (idiom)/fig. to endure bullying or insults stoically
pinyin: da3 diao4 men2 ya2 , wang3 du4 zi5 li3 yan4

sentences.english: The teacher's remarks humbled his pride.
sentences.chinese: 老師的一番話打掉了他的傲氣。

sentences.english: Anu returned to her gynecologist and aborted the fetus.
sentences.chinese: 阿奴回到婦科醫生那裏打掉了胎兒。

sentences.english: With amazing rapidity, young Chiang knocked away the props of his father's economic support.
sentences.chinese: 小蔣以驚人的速度打掉了他父親經濟基礎的支柱。

sentences.english: In the melee that followed, a policeman on horseback knocked out two of Apotheker's teeth.
sentences.chinese: 後來在一片混亂中，被騎警打掉了兩顆牙齒。

sentences.english: I just hated destroying his teeth.
sentences.chinese: 我就是不想打掉他的牙。

definition: to kill/to get rid of/(sports) to defeat/to eliminate
to hit/to strike/to attack/to crack down on sth/blow/(psychological) shock/percussion (music)
see 連鍋端|连锅端 [lian2 guo1 duan1]
to shatter/to smash/to break into pieces
